#  **Request for Standing Offer for Sewer, Grease Pits, and Related Systems Maintenance at CFB Gagetown, New Brunswick**

##  **Description**
The Department of National Defence (DND), Canadian Forces Base (CFB) Gagetown, seeks to establish a Regional Individual Standing Offer (RISO) for the maintenance of sewer, grease pits, and related systems at various facilities within the base's vicinity. This offer is expected to be based on an "as and when required" basis, with the period of performance spanning from July 1, 2023 to March 31, 2025.

##  **Scope of Work**
The selected contractor shall provide all necessary labour, materials, tools, and equipment to:

* Pump, clean, and video inspect sanitary and storm sewer systems
* Pump and clean sand and grease pits, as well as oil interceptors
* Carry out steam cleaning and degreasing services as required

##  **Contractor Requirements**
The contractor must have the capability to achieve the desired outcomes at the following locations:

* CDSB Gagetown facilities located in Oromocto, New Brunswick
* Training Area and surrounding areas
* Armouries located in Bathurst, Campbellton, Miramichi, Sussex, Moncton, Grand Falls, Saint John, Edmundston, and Fredericton

##  **Tender Requirements**
Interested suppliers are invited to submit their bids in either official language of Canada by the closing date of May 10, 2023 at 2:00 PM ADT. The selected contractor will be required to provide a performance bond for the entire duration of the contract.

##  **Additional Information**

* This opportunity is open to Canadian and international firms.
* The procurement will be conducted under the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement and other relevant free trade agreements.
* The contract value will be determined by the quantities of work completed during the contract period.
* Further information and supporting documents can be found on the Public Services and Procurement Canada [website](http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16000833?extsite=MTYwMDA4MzNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==).
* For any clarifications or additional information, please contact:
